com.oracle.truffle.api.vm

Class PolyglotRuntime.Instrument

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.oracle.truffle.api.vm.PolyglotRuntime.Instrument
  • Enclosing class:
    PolyglotRuntime

    public class PolyglotRuntime.Instrument
extends Object
    A handle for an instrument installed in the runtime, usable from other threads, that can observe and inject behavior into language execution. The handle provides access to the instrument's metadata and allows the instrument to be dynamically enabled/disabled in the runtime.

    All methods here, as well as instrumentation services in general, can be used safely from threads other than the engine's single execution thread.

    Refer to TruffleInstrument for information about implementing and installing instruments.

    Since:
    0.25
    See Also:
    PolyglotRuntime.getInstruments()

      • lookup

        public <T> T lookup(Class<T> type)
        Returns an additional service provided by this instrument, specified by type.

        Here is an example for locating a hypothetical DebuggerController: 

        Instrument instrument = engine.getInstruments().get(DebuggerExample.ID);
assert !isCreated(instrument) : "Not enabled yet";
debugger = instrument.lookup(DebuggerController.class);
assert isCreated(instrument) : "Got enabled";
assert debugger != null : "We can control the debugger";
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the service
        Parameters:
        type - class of the service that is being requested
        Returns:
        instance of requested type, null if no such service is available
        Since:
        0.9

      • setEnabled

        public void setEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Enables/disables this instrument in the engine.
        Parameters:
        enabled - true to enable false to disable
        Since:
